description: This table contains information about communication traces.

columns.name: COMM_TRACE_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier (.1 item) for the outreach record record.

columns.name: CONTACT_SERIAL_NUM
columns.description: The contact serial number (CSN) of the contact.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE_REAL
columns.description: A unique contact date in decimal format. The integer portion of the number indicates the date of contact. The digits after the decimal distinguish different contacts on the same date and are unique for each contact on that date. For example, .00 is the first/only contact, .01 is the second contact, etc.

columns.name: TEMPLATE_SETTING_ID
columns.description: Contains the base template that was sent for this trace.

columns.name: TEMPLATE_SETTING_ID_SETTING_NAME
columns.description: Setting record name.

columns.name: ROOT_TEMPLATE_SETTING_ID
columns.description: Contains the root base template sent to start the conversation this trace is a part of.

columns.name: ROOT_TEMPLATE_SETTING_ID_SETTING_NAME
columns.description: Setting record name.

columns.name: COMM_DIRECTION_C_NAME
columns.description:
The direction of this trace.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Outgoing


Incoming

columns.name: SENDER_SETTING_ID
columns.description: The sender record used to send this trace.

columns.name: SENDER_SETTING_ID_SETTING_NAME
columns.description: Setting record name.

columns.name: SEGMENT_COUNT
columns.description: The number of individual messages that the underlying gateway actually sent for this one message.

columns.name: COMM_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The status of this trace.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Created


Queued


Sidetracked


To Interconnect


To Cloud


Pending


Sent


Delivered


Canceled


Expired


Failed


Unknown


Auto-Invite Tank


Auto-Invite Queue


ECS Not In Use

columns.name: LEGACY_CONTENT_YN
columns.description:
If the content of this trace came from legacy content that was passed into the cache API, this flag should be set to indicate that this content DID NOT come from ECS build.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: LANGUAGE_ID
columns.description: Contains the language that was requested for this trace.

columns.name: LANGUAGE_ID_LANGUAGE_NAME
columns.description: The language name. If the language is written and uses more than one script to represent it, the name will contain the script in parentheses after the language name.

columns.name: RECV_PAT_ID
columns.description: If the recipient for the trace has an EPT, this should point to it.

columns.name: RECV_ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: If the recipient for the trace has an EAR, this should point to it.

columns.name: RECV_PAT_RELATION_ID
columns.description: If the recipient for the trace has a RLA, this should point to it.

columns.name: RECV_MYPT_ID
columns.description: If the recipient for the trace has a WPR, this should point to it.

columns.name: ABOUT_PAT_ID
columns.description: If this trace was about a specific patient, then this item should point to that patient. Note that the patient need not necessarily be a recipient.

columns.name: ABOUT_ACCOUNT_ID
columns.description: If this trace was about a specific guarantor, then this item should point to that guarantor. Note that the guarantor need not necessarily be a recipient.

columns.name: COMM_CREATE_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC that this trace was created in the database.

columns.name: SEND_REQ_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC that this trace was requested be sent.

columns.name: TO_CLOUD_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC that this trace was actually sent.

columns.name: SEND_EXP_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC time after which this message should NOT be sent.

columns.name: DELIVERY_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC instant that that the message was delivered (or as close as we can detect it).

columns.name: CLOUD_RECV_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC instant that cloud reports having received this message.

columns.name: DB_RECV_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: The UTC instant that cache received this message.

columns.name: COMM_EXT_NUMBER
columns.description: The external number associated with this trace. Data should be stored in E.164 format. The external number is the "to" number when sending from Epic, and the "from" number when receiving a mobile-originated message.

columns.name: COMM_INT_NUMBER
columns.description: The internal number associated with this trace. Data should be stored in E.164 format. The internal number is the "from" number when sending from Epic, and the "to" number when receiving a mobile-originated message.

columns.name: CONTENT_UTF_TEXT
columns.description: The content for the trace. This string should be UTF-8 encoded. The cloud foundation API limits characters to 1500. While not a perfect comparison using server logic, this item also uses 1500. A pure W1252 message is capped at 1500. With UTF8 characers taking various numbers of bytes, a UTF8 message may a lower limit, but that would be based on the characters used.

columns.name: CLOUD_MSG_IDENT
columns.description: The message ID for this trace that was assigned from the cloud/gateway.

columns.name: FACILITY_ID
columns.description: Contains the facility (EAF) record responsible for the message.

columns.name: SERV_AREA_ID
columns.description: Contains the service area (EAF) record responsible for the message.

columns.name: LOC_ID
columns.description: Contains the location (EAF) record responsible for the message.

columns.name: DEPARTMENT_ID
columns.description: Contains the department (DEP) record responsible for the message.

columns.name: BUS_SEG_POS_ID
columns.description: Contains the business segment (EAF) record responsible for the message.

columns.name: PRIORITY
columns.description: The priority for this trace. A value from 1-99 (inclusive) where 1 is high and 99 is low. Code should not set arbitrary values, code should use one of the predefined priority buckets using constants, eg: $$ecsConstPriorityMedium().

columns.name: PRE_COMM_WIN_SEND_REQ_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC instant that this trace was requested to be sent before applying communication window restrictions.

columns.name: TO_VENDOR_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC instant the status of this trace was updated to PENDING, indicating the message has been passed from cloud to the vendor.

columns.name: TO_NETWORK_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC instant the status of this trace was updated to Sent, indicating the message has been passed on to the network.

columns.name: FAILURE_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC instant the status of this trace was updated to Failed, indicating the message delivery has failed.

columns.name: SORT_INST_UTC_DTTM
columns.description: UTC instant that represents when the message was sent or received.

columns.name: RECV_USER_ID
columns.description: If the recipient for the trace has an EMP, this should point to it.

columns.name: ROOT_WORKFLOW_SETTING_ID
columns.description: Contains the root base workflow associated with the template sent to start the conversation this trace is a part of.

columns.name: ROOT_WORKFLOW_SETTING_ID_SETTING_NAME
columns.description: Setting record name.
